latestAction.text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. Hearings held.

item.title: An original concurrent resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2016 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2017 through 2025.

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.title: Preserving Access to Manufactured Housing Act of 2015

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 237 - 185 (Roll no. 149). (text: CR H2165-2166)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 237 - 185 (Roll no. 149).(text: CR H2165-2166)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 239 - 183 (Roll no. 148). (consideration: CR H2169-2170)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 189.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H2165-2171)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 19.
Resolution provides for consideration of 3 measures: H.R. 650; H.R. 685; and S. Con. Res. 11.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-65, by Mr. Sessions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-65, by Mr. Sessions.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 650) to amend the Truth in Lending Act to modify the definitions of a mortgage originator and a high-cost mortgage, providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 685) to amend the Truth in Lending Act to improve upon the definitions provided for points and fees in connection with a mortgage transaction, and providing for the adoption of the concurrent resolution (S. Con. Res. 11) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2016 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2017 through 2025.

Con. Res. 11) setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2016 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2017 through 2025.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
